item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 5, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. No more needles Tracking blood sugar on your wrist (138 points | 47 comments)
2. Guten: A Tiny Newspaper Printer (73 points | 29 comments)
3. Blur Busters Open Source Display Initiative – Refresh Cycle Shaders (19 points | 2 comments)
4. Combining 15s interval whole-sky-camera photos to form a 4y spanning keogram (403 points | 62 comments)
5. ELKS: Linux for 16-bit Intel Processors (136 points | 57 comments)
6. Refurb Weekend: Atari Stacy (19 points | discuss)
7. University of Alabama Engineer Pioneers New Process for Recycling Plastics (2024) (95 points | 81 comments)
8. GPON FTTH networks (in)security (2016) (10 points | discuss)
9. Hacker gains access to the RP2350 OTP secret by glitching the RISC-V cores (44 points | 2 comments)
10. How to draw an outline in a video game (458 points | 50 comments)
11. Self driving 1993 Volvo with open pilot (572 points | 127 comments)
12. One Dog vs. the Windows 3.1 Graphics Stack (185 points | 70 comments)
13. Hornet, RNA structure visualization method correlates sequence and 3D topology (8 points | 1 comment)
14. Show HN: WebGPU + TypeScript Slime Mold (52 points | 7 comments)
15. The comb jelly can fuse with another (including nervous and digestive systems) (41 points | 6 comments)
16. It Matters Who Owns Your Copylefted Copyrights (2021) (84 points | 90 comments)
17. Labwc: Wlroots-based window-stacking compositor for Wayland, inspired by openbox (39 points | 9 comments)
18. Myst Markdown – Markdown for technical/scientific document (28 points | 5 comments)
19. PyPI Blog: Project Quarantine (63 points | 6 comments)
20. Visually Compare Retry Algorithms (4 points | discuss)
21. No-hole surgery: no keyhole, yet surgeons can now still operate under your skin (55 points | 14 comments)
22. Hacking yourself a satellite – recovering BEESAT-1 [video] (141 points | 7 comments)
23. A Return to Polymathy (2015) [pdf] (120 points | 55 comments)
24. Meta is killing off its AI-powered Instagram and Facebook profiles (329 points | 465 comments)
25. Phase behavior of Cacio and Pepe sauce (341 points | 170 comments)
26. Ask HN: How are you using LLMs for traversing decompiler output? (88 points | 40 comments)
27. The DIY Multideck (112 points | 44 comments)
28. Show HN: Pretty-print your chess games using Prettier (83 points | 8 comments)
29. Show HN: I created a PoC for live descriptions of the surroundings for the blind (36 points | 7 comments)
30. Web page annoyances that I don't inflict on you here (167 points | 54 comments)
